meanings.definition: The phenomenon where a single gene has multiple effects on an organism.
meanings.sent1: Pleiotropy can cause one gene to influence many different aspects of an organism.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pleiotropy to understand how genes can impact various traits in an organism.
meanings.sent3: The concept of pleiotropy makes genetics class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic world, pleiotropy is like a domino effect, one gene triggering multiple outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a colorful diagram to explain pleiotropy to the students.

meanings.definition: The condition of having multiple phenotypic effects from a single gene.
meanings.sent1: Pleiotropy results in diverse physical characteristics from a single gene.
meanings.sent2: Understanding pleiotropy helps in comprehending the complexity of genetic traits.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the mouse had a case of pleiotropy, causing it to have big ears and a long tail.
meanings.sent4: The impact of pleiotropy on an organism is like a ripple effect, spreading across various traits.
meanings.sent5: The textbook had a fascinating section explaining pleiotropy with colorful illustrations.
